availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert Wilford (Trigg County, Kentucky, overseer, farmer, and juror)

body.p: Trigg County, Kentucky, overseer, farmer, and juror. Trigg County, Kentucky, native. Son of Bennett Wilford and Sarah Randolph Wilford. Married to Nancy Jane Manning Wilford in Trigg County, Kentucky, on February 1, 1849. Overseer for Albert G. Dabney in Trigg County in 1844. Farmer in Trigg County in 1850. Farmer in Trigg County in 1860. Owned eight enslaved persons in Trigg County in 1860. Juror in the Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Thomas B. Wadlington in Caldwell County on December 8, 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, District 1, p. 310A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, Cadiz, p. 108.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, p. 381A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Trigg County Marriages, Film #000321335, p. 125.
William Henry Perrin, Counties of Christian and Trigg, Kentucky (Chicago: F. A. Battery, 1884), 208-9.
Find A Grave, "Robert Wilford (1823-1892)," Memorial #88566436, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/88566436 (accessed May 23, 2021).
KYR-0001-020-0001.
